instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-01598: What is 820-01598? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PPVBAT_G3H_CONN: What is PPVBAT_G3H_CONN? This is the where the batteryâ€™s power rail connects to the motherboard. .
definitions.SYS_DETECT_L: What is SYS_DETECT_L? For detection of the battery.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting or running on battery after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
Hi all.

I'm working on a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that had water damage.
It originally came in not turning on.

The only signs of corrosion was on the bottom side of the board.
There was a small amount of corrosion on the battery PCB,
On the logic board, there was a small amount of corrosion near F7000.

I'll attach an image of the logic board.
The other areas that had corrosion do not seem to be related to the battery charging.

I cleaned off the logic board and battery PCB and tested it.
The unit powered on and booted OK, however the battery reported 1% and failed to charge at all.
If I disconnected the USBC, it would immediately turn off.

I shut it down, and tested with a new battery.
The unit powered on and was charging the battery - the charge increased from 70-80% while charging.
The System information correctly detected the battery, and said the new battery had a charge count of zero.

I left the job on the bench last Friday.
[B]This morning I again powered it on, and it doesn't detect the battery at all.[/B]

I tried PRAM/SMC reset.
I re-seated the battery.
I tried with another new battery.
None of the new batteries detect, charge, or will run on the battery alone.

I tested with USBC connected, with the customers genuine 3A charger, and a workshop 4A charger as well.

F7000 is not shorted, reads 12.61v with USBC connected.
On the battery BMU Flex Solder Pads, <SIGNAL>PPVBAT_G3H_CONN</SIGNAL> also reads 12.61v.

I don't think it is related, but near F7000, a zero ohm resistor, <RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR>, reads open resistance.
It measures 12.61v on pin1, <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> and 0v on Pin2, <SIGNAL>PPVIN_S4_TPAD_FUSE</SIGNAL>.
The location on the board for F6700, the TPAD Fuse, is not populated.

I'm not sure where to start diagnosing this.
I've had little experience with batteries in these units, usually once I can get them working they've charged and worked on battery fine.

Any help greatly appreciated.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting or running on battery after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R6700</RESISTOR> is not battery related.
You must resolder it anyway; <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is needed by the trackpad actuator.

First check <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> signals.
Wrong values may be caused by corroded <RESISTOR>R6956</RESISTOR>, or <TRANSISTOR>Q6955</TRANSISTOR>.

<DIODE>D6950</DIODE> is another suspect.
Check diode mode on SCL/SDA lines before and after <TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting or running on battery after liquid ingress.
threads.message:
Hi 2informaticos.
Long time no speak. :)
Thanks for your suggestions.

<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT</SIGNAL> 3.29v
<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL> 0v

<RESISTOR>R6956</RESISTOR> is 10K ohm. 3.29v on both pins.
<TRANSISTOR>Q6955</TRANSISTOR> 0v on pin3 (<SIGNAL>SYS_DETECT_L</SIGNAL>)
<TRANSISTOR>Q6950</TRANSISTOR>:
Pin1 1.8v
Pin2 1.8v
Pin3 3.3v
Pin4 1.8v
Pin5 1.8v
Pin6 Fluctuates slightly between 3.24v and 3.29v

Diode mode, red to ground:
Pin1 428
Pin2 -721 (beeps)
Pin3 431
Pin4 428
Pin5 -722 (beeps)
Pin6 431

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-01598</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not detecting or running on battery after liquid ingress.
threads.message: I suspect corrosion between J6951 pins.
